Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan finished bottom of the Super 4s at the Asia Cup and Naseem Shah has been ruled out of the tournament.

Netherlands' major disappointment stems from both their warm-up games being rain-affected - with one completely washed out - which means the last 50-over game of any sort they collectively played came in the final of the World Cup Qualifier three months ago.
Shadab Khan's poor form, particularly with the ball, and especially in this format, have seen once-unthinkable calls for his omission from the starting line-up.
Bas de Leede has the opportunity to show how well he's going after a year out from the unfortunate Perth encounter where he was injured by Haris Rauf.
Team news: Possible XI for Pakistan: 1 Fakhar Zaman 2 Imam-ul-Haq 3 Babar Azam (capt) 4 Mohammad Rizwan (wk) 5 Saud Shakeel/Salman Ali Agha 6 Iftikhar Ahmed 7 Shadab Khan 8 Mohammad Nawaz 9 Hasan Ali 10 Shaheen Shah Afridi 11 Haris Rauf

Possible XI for Netherlands: 1 Vikramjit Singh 2 Max O'Dowd 3 Wesley Barresi 4 Bas de Leede 5 Colin Ackermann 6 Scott Edwards (capt &wk) 7 Ryan Klein 8 Logan van Beek 9 Roelof van der Merwe, 10 Shariz Ahmed 11 Paul van Meekeren
